description: Removed... slow to load and clunky..
The App doesnt work!
It came installed in Kubunut 22.04.1, but when I press Launch nothing happens.
I'm using Lubuntu 20.04 with Kubuntu desktop, and I works pretty nice, no problems I've faced yet, needs very little to no configurations if everything is in their supposed place,
summary: Don't know about others, works as expected atleast for me

description: Just plain doesn't lauch. Doesn't even look it's trying to work. Next.....
At this point in time, Elisa isn't the most feature-filled music player, but what it does it does well, and it looks really good doing it. The full-screen Party Mode is great for parties!

This is an awesome program. It's capable of managing my huge playlist. It combines abilities like find artist images, cover pictures and managing playlists with a nice and clean straight forward simple interface. It works for me. I have another players with that eye candy super awesome night party visual style. I had another GTK soft for that but is gone. Elisa wins for simplicity, versatility, capabilities yet straight forward config and class.

Almost forget. If you close it it can stay on system tray which is great if you don't want a minimized window while you work. Thumbs up for that function.

It's not the player for people who wants a mega-visual experience managing their music collection. It's able to do it but not that way. This is a sober classy looking soft and Iḿ sure that if you are looking for a QT player for the everyday company (also manages radio streams) it's for you.

Great piece of soft!
summary: Awesome. It offers a lot but keeps it simple

description: I've used this for the last few years, best music player for Neon I've found. Solid, never buggy, with all the key options missing from other music players (like easily customizable playlists and being able to bring up what track in a playlist is currently playing).
summary: Still works great on KDE Neon

description:
elisa dosn't play if music file's pic is larger than a certain size.
ACG player was my favorite player amog all platforms. I wish there was similar option for linux.
summary: a thumbnale problem & visual improvement is required!

description: Cannot control volume using slider. System volume control works perfectly.
Blazing-fast file indexing thanks to Baloo. Works as expected. Honors my system dark theme.
summary: Does what it's supposed to do

description: i love it, there's some bugs still since it's in its early days but i can look past that. but please add the private version of the app too, which doesn't use baloo, as i'd like to restrict it to scanning only one path!
summary: add the private version of that app too!

description: This app is still pre-release so there quite a few features missing which you would expect from a music player. The stuff which is there though works beautifully and the development is very active and it's getting better and better. The UI is very nice and user friendly and I currently prefer it to other music players since I am not very demanding. I very much expect to be able to give 5 stars once it releases properly.

Installation was a headache, seeing as I had to install the whole flatpak (probably not entirely the dev's fault, but still a horrible experience).
Afterwards, each time I execute it, it sure does take its time before apearing on the desktop, sometimes up to 3 minutes.
Furthermore, I added a folder on my NTFS fs to the library, but it is unable to index the music files.

All in all, not so usable at this stage, at least for me.
I so miss Amarok.
It's really a simple music player. If you need more functionality this is probably not the app you want. But if you want a quick, efficient, simple and lean music player this is your app.
Nothing happens when launching it. Kubuntu 18.10.  Error when launching from CLI is error while loading shared libraries: libelisaLib.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

There are very few kde music player out there like amarok, clementine etc. But they are too old for modern desktop. Elisa has modern UI, good integration with KDE. Needed feature. Thats enough for men.
I have a huge music collection (about 18,000 tracks) and with this Elisa gets freeze and lagged. More frequently when is scanning music folders.

now somehow merge clementine's features with this and we will have the best music player in the linux world! ... in my opinion at least.
one problem i have is lags when switching to "cover mode" (is that what it's called?) back and fort.
but this app is still in early development so im sure this will be improved.
most beautiful music player i ever seen in linux distros.In Kde Neon it Works perfectly
Immediately segfaults.
cool lightweigth music player
Looks cool, but it didn't play well with my theming (black icons went missing on my black theme). I also missed the hability to create lots of playlists (if it exists, I couldn't find it)...
Crashes immediately on startup
App does very briefly launch, but crashes immediately, every time.

Got this running on Ubuntu 20.04 using flatpack guide here 

https://askubuntu.com/questions/1120160/how-to-run-elisa-music-player

this application actually reminds me discover at the beginning unable to open it even, and that's the case for Elisa doesn't even start without crashing I actually didn't even get to see how it looks. I like KDE but they need to really be sure that the applications they make available are good enough that's exactly the kind of stuff that drive people away from Linux and KDE in particular, I don't mind however many people that I introduced to Linux and KDE get frustrated and leave for Apple or stay with Microsoft.
All I want is last.fm scrobbling - but I guess I can live without it

I'm really into HD music and into high fidelity audio in general. I own several external DACS and purchase HD tracks where I can. My fiance also happens to be an amateur musician and guess what her name is? Elisa! I downloaded this application purely because of it's name and it has slowly become my favourite linux audio player. It's simple, does what it says on the tin, nice and clean interface. Great application.
summary: Personally to me a greap app name

description: This really is a bare bones audio player that looks beautiful and is light on resources. Recommended
great interface and uasablity but constantly crashes. Please fix the crashes.

I've tried a whole bunch of music players on KDE Neon; this is the best. It's the only one that looks nice and really matches the native theme (in my case, dark Sweet); has easy and logical playlist creation; and lets you jump to the currently playing song in the playlist, which is so helpful.
summary: The best KDE music player by far

description: The interface looks great, like a good compromise between simplicity and functionality. However, on start it renders my system almost totally and permanently unresponsive. The music library contains just a few tracks so that can't be the cause. No other music players I've tried do this.
Cant search songs, cant download lyrics. One and only configurable option is changing music directory and that's it.
Definitely the best player I've found for KDE. Simple, beautiful, with all the right features.

I love KDE but there are more userfriendly apps for KDE. You can't browse your filesystem easily and on a 4k Display it's a mess. Most of the items are too big. Can't resize the window and it just need more UI work. Nice effort though.
SImple app to the point without much fuss, but I don't see much reason to use this instead of better lot more feature and equally simple to use RhythmBox
summary: So So,but misses a lot of features like Podcast, LibreFm etc

description:
This player is missing a lot of features other players have.
The user experience of Elisa is still flawed. I can't add a folder to play list, I have to navigate inside of it and then add all the files to replace my playlist. I cannot select a folder or multiple files to append to playlist.
The cover art doesn't display and there is a lot of wasted screen space of the app.
summary: missing a lot of features other players have

description:
Has a good potential, but falls short on many aspects:
- preference menu is basically empty
- starts playing on player open... a no go for me
- does not sort by album artist, onlty artist
There's a black window that looks like its been launched but no interface pops up

Purely horrible!! Files section on left column shows only the home folder and not the other added paths. I stumbled on a bug that whatever album you choose from the album section it shows the contents of a completely different one. Sorting by genres is laughable but could be a fault of metadata. Does not let you drag individual songs in the playlists column. Non-existant configuration options. 

Honestly, you should take a page from Amarok's book and try to make a simplified version of that.
summary: Too much focus on looks zero focus on usability

description: This is a good music player, minus the freezing and irregular menu layout. I'll stick with audacious.

In the UI/UX, I find there to be too much focus on it looking snazzy (and that it does well) and "modern" (i.e. Tiles everywhere), rather than being functional.
There's no obvious way to view your files in a "traditional" manner, i.e. not as Tiles based on either Album or Artist. I mean a list of your stuff, like you'd remember from any good 'ol music player like Itunes(!).
I can't seem to save a playlist IN THE PLAYER. But I can save as in export it.
There are literally 5 settings in Settings. 
Overall, it's a decent player, but feels too limited and too much "modern" in the Gnome and Windows 10 sense, i.e. it feels rigid and limited in it's options and simplified in it's UI. Ironically, the Gnome player feels more like a good old music player with options x)
I want to like it, because it's fast, it looks nice, and overall is a good player, But the UI feels cumbersome due to how it arranges and forces you to interact with your music.
5 stars for being nice.
Minus 3 stars for the how the layout/UI is arranged.

A better layout would, imo, be:
Left > Center > Right:
Sidebar > List of files > Thumbnails of albums

Where the sidebar actually have a Library place, and that you can just drag-and-drop into playlists in the sidebar.

Looks great visually, and it does play music files, but lacks too much functionality at this point. Features I would like to see - option to hide panels, bind hotkey to clear playlist, in file view fix buttons to play/add folders to playlist (now they do nothing), option to add other directories than Home to files view, option to change view from folders to list, option to drag and drop files from dolphin to playlist.

The interface to Elisa is great, but every time I start it it spends ages using a lot of CPU to re-index my entire music collection.

Strawberry (Clementine fork) is a more up to date excellent music player.

Elisa is a nice-looking player that allows me to listen to my .ogg and .mp3 files without any issues. It doesn't seem to have many add-ons right now, but that will come. This is my music player of choice on KDE.
This music player is fantastic. great job. KDE Team

Before the 21.04 updates I would not have felt able to recommend Elisa to anyone due to constant crashes, but now it seems like an actually nice music player.
There are still quirks that make it a little uncomfortable to use compared to other music players like Strawberry, but you will likely get used to them.

The design is obviously very mobile-like, which I usually dislike, but I can tolerate it with Elisa.
There is close to no configuration possible with Elisa.

I like it, you should try it.

It has the potential to be a great program, but at the moment it has very serious flaws, such as the inability to manage your music with a list in the traditional way. A simple view mode button would solve this problem.
summary: Can be good someday, but not now..

description: Its a good program but the big issue I have is every time I go to list the folders of music and scroll down it crashes every time. Tried reporting it. To me this makes it hard to use as my music is in folders and the meta data is not always there or correct. Hopefully this will get fixed at somepoint but for now, I have to use something else.
Very basic and very poor audio player. Very slow to read it's own database. No smart playlists. Poor search.

I launch one playlist, and Elisa plays some other playlist.
How wonderful is that?!
Crashes immediately upon launch. Uninstalled.
I can only search for music on my OS drive, pointless since my music library is on an external RAID
WHY?! Your website has at least five new versions.
Crashes as you try to open it. Too bad :-(

Auto Generates LOCAL Album ART unlike Lollipop player which tries to automatically scrape inaccurate album art without my permission
this is the only music player that matters to me i've tried the others they suck i want to see my locally stored 2k album art with no online interference.

Yet another very limited not to say boring Linux music player, which seems to have been designed for children! Acceptable sound quality and lots of scheme colours to choose from but no possibility to see more than one playlist, no graphic equalizer and of course no scheduler, something unavailable in all Linux music players known to me; it seems it is beyond the capabilities of Linux boffins to create as versatile a player as Aimp3, unfortunately only for Windows...
crashes after install
Downloaded from the repository and it does not start.
Nothing to review since I can't configure with my music sources. Need fix, or help if anyone knows why settings not opening.
summary: Settings window not opening on Ubuntu 20.04

description:
It will play music. I will give it that.
But the UI is horrendous with no way to change it in any meaningful way. Get WINE and WinAMP.

the most buggy app I've ever seen ) so hard to just listen music! 
first you should find playlist button in interface, than create playlist from all your tracks, than you can listen music, if app not crash ) the app is very raw, it's hard to use without pain ...
Runs well, very pretty UI, dosn't crash, displays album art. I'm not really a fan of the playlist focus instead of instant play. But the app is nice enough I can deal with it.

Why Rate a application BAD when it's amazing ? This is the only Radio player that comes with Reggae Music , so that is already a amazing thing for me , it looks nice , you can add stations , I have no problems , but i,m on Debian , most stable Kernel 5.1 LTS DirtyPipe Free ..LMAO ,,all who rate this application BAD are Bloody idiots , I Puck Darlington said so..

Thanks , a Tip for ELisa , the Instrumental Radio link must be updated , and add some more stations
I have a list for you if you need ..
Contact me at Youtube/channel48 PS I could not see the stars to RATE my RAting is 5 STARS !MAX

I installed this music player previously on Fedora Workstation via RPM. Worked just fine. However, due to Nvidia, F35 KDE defaulting to wayland and issues not starting, I went with Fedora Kinoite. So everything is a Flatpak. The Flatpak version of this cannot find my music, and I used Flatseal to modify the permissions. Still could not find my music and kept not working.

Good music player, when it works.
summary: Can't find my music files on Fedora Kinoite

description: On the latest Ubuntu Studio, this program refuses to start and now I'm sad. Took it off and after two updates to the OS, put it back again and no change. It made me feel good while I was able to play it on KDE Manjaro, tested it with FLAC files. Please fix this, I feel like I lost my girlfriend.
Nice player, but that is core functionality for me.
This doesn't accept fresh music in your folders by standard. I don't even know it's standards by posting this. Geez. Could be great but no, just repulsing.
Double-clicking another file does not override the currently played one.
summary: Looks nice, but base function's don't work properly

description: Nice, actively developed, with really nice updates.

Always appreciate contributions made by members of the community. The player is beautiful. Some improvements can be made to make managing playlist more intuitive. Other than that the Elisa music player is awesome. 
Learning how to contribute and develop apps make one appreciate a solid effort. My own projects is only for family and friends and it will be a while till I will also contirbute software to the ecosystem. 
Good job to the Elisa team and 5 stars for design of this player.
best linux media player period

This works for me, flatpak option didn't show in fedora35 app store until i added the bottom sources(1)
then i had to install the flatpak manually(2)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
(1 )
flatpak remote-add --if-not-exists flathub https://flathub.org/repo/flathub.flatpakrepo
(2)
flatpak install flathub org.kde.elisa.desktop
still my favorite music player.but the weird thing is i already had third party repositories checked an restarted my pc and the app store should of picked up the flathub variant automatically .
either way after the to steps everything works perfect especiallt the dark mode as usuall the rmp still no longer shows that & still crashes
summary: Fedora35 Gnome41 / only elisa flatpak version works, RPM one crashes

description: Programm startet noch nicht mal!

Elisa spielt und verwaltet Musiksammlungen. Allerdings lässt das Programm viele wichtige Eigenschaften vermissen:
- Anzeige von eingebeteten Cover-Bildern (VLC kann das)
- ID3-Tag Bearbeitung nicht möglich
- Fotos z.B. bei der Interpretenanzeige fehlen
- Songtexte (Lyrics) werden nicht angezeigt
- Import von m3u-Listen bei Radiostationen
- Anzeige von Künstlerinformationen
- Meta-Daten-Generierung aus Dateinamen fehlt
- Meta-Daten-Generierung aus Datenbanken (MusicBrainz) fehlt
- für den vergleichsweise geringen Informaitonsumfang benötigt die Anwendung viel zu viel Fläche auf dem Bildschirm. Wäre gut, wenn Elisa im Hintergrund laufen könnte aber:
- Fenster schließen (X) beendet Elisa, anstatt das Programm im Hintergrund weiterlaufen zu lassen

Es ist noch ein weiter Weg um Amarok annähernd zu ersetzen.
Programm lädt die Sammlung bei jedem Start neu.
Die Bewertungen hier waren erst etwas verwirrend, vor allem nachdem ich Elisa jetzt etwas getestet habe. Funktioniert super, flüssig, sieht gut aus, intuitiv. Ist wirklich zu empfehlen!
radio von playlist nicht so gut, nicht mal titel usw. angaben, clementine kann das.
Already good player, but my favorite is still Lollypop, which is better in the feature - usability ratio in my opinion. Feels better at least.
Excelente calidad de reproducción (bajo consumo de recursos) Recomendado para el escritorio Plasma de KDE.
Excelente interfaz y sencillo de usar. Comparable con reproductores mas reconocidos, como Groove de Windows.

Me encantó este reproductor, funciona perfecto en KDE Neon (que de hecho no viene con ningún reproducto de música). Me gusta poder ver las carátulas de mis discos y la interfaz en general se ve muy bien.
Me encanta pero me gustaria agregar más radios por ejemplo podcasting de youtube :3 con eso y pongo 5 Estrellas

Es un buen reproductor de musica pero conpararado con lollypop se queda un poco atras ya que no muestra las caratulas de los albunes y artistas ya qure tengo los dos instalados y este no las muestra y el otro si....
lo instale en fedora 31 y la aplicacion no abre
poco configurable
Estoy usando este reproductor porque es muy intuitivo aparte sinceramente tiene un buen interfaz!

te permite navegar entre las carpetas para encontrar lo que sea que quieras reproducir, lo que no me gusta es que no reproduce tus canciones de forma automatica si te pones en una carpeta, no te permite crear tus propios albuns para una reproducción autmática del mismo y esta bien raro el poner en cola distintas canciones para que las reprodusca pq siempre las reproduce dos veces y no cambia la canción
funciona todo muy bien, gran interfaz, algo sencilla pero muy bien funciona.
En general trabaja bien, pero cuando se reanuda la reproducción se tartamudea unos segundos. Seria valorado que los desarrolladores añadan la edición de la metadata de las pistas de audio
Bonito, sencillo, integracion perfecta con KDE.
Tiene un diseño moderno y funciona excelente bajo el escritorio KDE.
Excelente Trabajo, me encanta quisiera que le agreguen un minireproductor para que se muestre sobre las ventanas me encanta sinceramente sigan mejorandolo.

De lo mejor que he probado, sin duda un
gran acierto su instalación en Lubuntu.
Gracias a los desarrolladores.
Muy bueno, sencillo y muy facil de manejar
Lo he probado y me ha encando sus diseños. Es un reproductor simple y bastante ligero. Pero no soporta todos los formatos, me gustaría que tuviera más soporte. En general, bien.
summary: Excelente reproductor pero no soporta todas la extensiones

description: apenas lo ejecuto se cierra, en ubuntu 21.04
De repente se cieera
La columna de la izquierda, "files (archivos)" no permite una ruta diferente donde buscar mi biblioteca de audio.
No hace nada!!

Me parece que todo está demasiado desparramado por la interfaz, no es intuitiva la búsqueda y las listas son demasiado grandes con toda la información puesta. A veces, menos es más y cuando solo quieres buscar tu música, todo lo demás distrae.
La carátula que presenta no se corresponde con la que está incrustada en la canción.

Agreguenle el scrobling de Lastfm.es para loguearme. 

+ Barra de progreso
- No se puede loguear con Lastfm.es

La verdad, muy funcional, nada de que quejarse.
Hasta el momento todo bien muy limpio el diseño.
No puedes reproducir archivos desde una red local

Comparado con otros, creo que se queda justo. Para que muestre las carátulas hay que añadir un archivo cover.jpg en la carpeta, y eso no pasa en otros como Lollypop y VLC 4.0 que llegará pronto. También echo de menos un ecualizador para cuando uso auriculares. Por todo lo demás, bien en KDE.
J'utilise Elisa depuis plusieurs mois maintenant et son fonctionnement est irréprochable !

Une application KDE très prometteuse et au design vraiment soigné mais qui souffre de bug de jeunesse (nous ne sommes qu'en 0.4 après tout ^^). N'est pas encore utilisable en tant que lecteur au quotidien et/ou par défaut.

l'application bug à mort. et le pire c'est qu'elle pertube le fonctionnement du système principalement l'affichage de tous le bureau qui commence à buguer lorsque elisa est ouvert. franchement elle me mène la vie dure. donc je la balance. désinstallation vite faite!

bon départ pour une application toute simple

Avec les lyrics, des animations et la possibilité de demarrage et arret programmé ca serait top.

Il y a quelque chose qui me fait tiquer...
Quand on va dans le dossier / usr/ share/ metainfo et qu'on ouvre le fichier "org.kde.elisa.appdata.xml", on peut constater qu'il y a un lien vers Microsoft.
Pourquoi ce lien ?
Pour l'instant n'as connu ni plantage, ni soucis et est parfaitement intégré sous KDE (encore heureux). Bref, un lecteur de base idéal.
summary: Fait son job, et le fait bien

description: super ... mais ne lit que ce qui il a dans sa "bibliothèque". impossible d'écouter un morceau dans un dossier, quand on clique dessus !!
при попытке зайти в настройки приложения ничего не происходит, ошибку не исправляют годами
все заебись продолжаю писать
При попытке вызвать меню настроек падает в обморок
Не запускается, открывается пустое окно и всё. Ошибок не выдает. Кубунта 18.04

KDE Neon. Не может найти директорию музыки, нет глобального меню, деревянный интерфейс который нельзя настроить. 

Крайне не рекомендую!
summary: Крайне убогое приложение, не рекомендую к установке

description: Конечно нужно немного пофиксить а так смотрится не плохо
KDE NEON всё работает,с не достатков нет эквалайзера
Классный интерфейс. Хороший функционал. Крайне рекомендую, для каталога музыки самое то.

Установил вчера бета версию kubuntu 20.04. Плеер поменяли, была же кантата, ну да ладно. Почему-то ощущение было, что можно поменять обложку как в aimp(странно почему еще аимпа нет в линукс). Снова это пропустим. Дефолтные радиостанции понравились. Меньше плеер не сделать и это факт.

Мне понравился интерфейс приложения и из-за этого решил дать ему шанс.
Поставил потестировать.
Указал все папки, в которых находится музыка.
У меня несколько дисков и все медиа файлы, которых огромное количество хранятся не в домашней директории, а на отдельном диске.
Данный диск монтируется автоматически и проблем с ним в других медиа-плеерах (в том числе, которые сканируют твою библиотеку) не было.
Данное приложение у меня простояло несколько месяцев (надеялся что допилят).
За все это время только один раз оно увидело мою библиотеку и просканировало ее.
Но уже на следующий день вся музыка из приложения таинственным образом исчезла.

Также пытался скармливать данному плееру плейлисты.
Он их загружает, но так как в библиотеке о этих треках нет никакой информации, то он просто показывает пустые строки в количестве, соответствующем количеству треков в плейлисте.
При попытке нажать на них и начать воспроизведение выдает ошибку.

Очень странное поведение.
Надеюсь, что рано или поздно поправят косяки и допилят приложение.
Если так случится то буду готов исправить свой отзыв.
summary: Не может найти музыку на компьютере

description:
1. Меню настроек. Единственное,что там можно "настроить" - это папка с музыкой.
2. Нет возможности свернуть это поделие в лоток. Кому как, но для меня неудобно, когда на панели задач висит свёрнутое окно.
3. Убогая реализация списка воспроизведения. Непонятно, можно ли добавить сразу всю фонотеку в список воспроизведения - вместо этого "список" формируется из отдельных песен, когда включаешь проигрывание. Для меня это нелепо, неудобно и вообще не нравится такой подход.
4. Нет возможности отображения текста песен.
5. Единственный плюс - звук достаточно мощный, по сравнению с той же клементиной, которой приходится пользоваться в настоящее время из-за того, что Amarok не поддерживается на убунту 20.04.
Итог: Elisa - худший аудиоплеер, с которым я знаком. Называть его "аудиоплеером", не говоря уж о том, что ЭТО вообще сделали (насколько я понимаю) дефолтным "плеером" в Kubuntu - это нечто сродни попытке выдать кусок испражнений за эталон чего-то прекрасного и нужного.
Моё пожелание разработчикам - либо беритесь за портирование Amarok на QT5, либо дорабатавайте своё "изделие" до уровня хотя бы той же Clementine. Либо просто выпейте цианида и не позорьтесь больше, создавая нечто подобное ЭТОМУ.
Всё устраивает. Нормальный плеер.
OuiFM_Classic_Rock не работает?! Добавьте пожалуйста OUI FM - ALTERNATIF, у меня не получается это сделать
Установилось только через терминал. Но толку нет . Плеер не запускается.
Неплохой плеер, настроек правдо маловато и обложки в id3 не все видит
Не запустилось. Что тут говорить то.
попробуйте догадаться как туда музыку закинуть
ПРиложение не читает CUE файлы, не видит обложки, не возможности выбрать расположения медиафайлов, Не удобная сортировка фалов по группам
Но программа схлопывается при прокрутке аудиодороже во вкладке "Файлы"
